Detailed Description

Author:
K.A. Remington, edited by Mark Hoemmen
Version:
1.1
Date:
Time-stamp: <2008-07-16 11:23:30 mhoemmen>
Harwell-Boeing sparse matrix file I/O routines. Mark Hoemmen (mfh) made some modest bug fixes (e.g. improving robustness of the header parsing routines), and changed _SP_base to zero.

Function Documentation

char * mfh_upcase ( char *  S  ) 

Their original upcase would modify in place, which is a problem for constant strings (some compilers don't let you do that). This function mallocs a fresh string (which you must then free).

char * substr ( const char *  S,
const int  pos,
const int  len 
)

Returns the substring of length len starting at position pos. Mallocs a fresh string, so call free when you are done.
